name: The Queen Moth
description:
To play just download and unzip the build, inside of the folder you could find a file with the Unreal logo, just double click on it to open the game.

Explore the house and surroundings to find your way to the queen moth. This is a story of someone kidnapped in dreams to fight against an evil form.

The controls are:

  • awsd / arrows to move
  • direction + shift to run
  • click to attack when you have a weapon equiped
  • i to open the inventory
  • p / esc to pause menu
  • f to turn on-off the lighter

I develop this tiny survival horror using Unreal blueprint system as last work for game design class last year, it is round 15 minutes long, and was inspired on horror movies with slow killers, like It Follows. The most of the assets were made combining the resources of the engine (except the monster's tentacles which were the first thing I modeled in blender as an experiment). The external resources I have used are:

  • Sound:

            -  Main theme of the game: Right Behind You by Kevin MacLeod

            -  Save Room Sound: Music For Funeral Home by Kevin Macleod

               (Both from filmmusic.io)

  • Models:

            -  Trees mesh by Hemppainen

            -  Doorknob pickup mesh by Garnaga

            -  Bullets pickup mesh by Cloudskipper

               (All downloaded on Turbosquid)

  • Icons:

            -  Dagger by Davide Tomatis

            -  Gun by Jauhari

            -  Bullets by B Farias 

            -  Shears by Arunika 

            -  Key by Orin Zuu

            -  Draw by Viktor Fedyuk (Tim P)

            -  Note by Joeartcon 

             (All from the Noun Project)

Thanks for the attention, all feedback are welcome, wish you enjoy!
